name: Where Nightmares Meet
description: Cadet Picard's abduction by a Borg cube sets the Federation on high alert. The Collective's insistence that these Borg are acting independently does little to ease suspicions and may lead to more division. Which path will you take to rescuing Picard?
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Faction Missions and Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Seven, Burnham, Odo, or Picard and Number One, or Astrophysicists will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Seven, Burnham, Odo, Picard and Number One, or Astrophysicists
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

action.name: The Old Michael Burnham is Dead

featured_crew.flavor: Stranded after a runabout crash, Odo and Quark were forced to cooperate to survive.

adventures.name: Suspicions Disproven
adventures.description: Gather proof that the overall Collective was uninvolved.

adventures.name: Tenuous Ties
adventures.description: Research the relevant tenets of peace with the Borg.

adventures.name: Whispered Space
adventures.description: Decode communications with the rogue Borg cube.

adventures.name: Traces in the Night
adventures.description: Track the abducted Picard with the compiled intel.

rewards.name: Where Nightmares Meet
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: Odo
rewards.flavor: Stranded after a runabout crash, Odo and Quark were forced to cooperate to survive.

action.name: The Old Michael Burnham is Dead

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "Captain, I can assure you the abduction of Picard's younger self is as disconcerting for the Collective as it is for the Federation."
"The Collective has been unsuccessful in establishing contact with the derelict cube. They are fully committed to recovering the cube and any Starfleet personnel it might have seized."
"I trust that declaration as much as I trust a Romulan to cover my back. Spare us the diplomatic posturing. You couldn't have picked a more annoying Federation trait to assimilate."

"Enough. Time is a luxury we do not have. With so many bitter rivalries set aside in the interest of finding the missing cube, surely you can bite your tongue long enough to do what needs to be done, Terran."
"It took you long enough to actually make headway, Captain, but I suppose you did manage to prove useful in the end."

responses.text: "Indeed. I doubt there is a Borg who does not know Locutus."
"Yes. He is rather infamous among Romulans."
"His service record is full of accounts of peaceful instances of first contact."

screens.text: "A picture is beginning to emerge of why they chose to pursue the young Picard. His influence is felt throughout the galaxy, so it feels only natural those intent on abducting him would be prepared to disappear so quickly."

"True. Any drone would immediately recognize Locutus, who brought them such valuable insight and unfiltered access to the Federation. But beyond his utility, few Borg would concern themselves with his human identity as Picard. The Borg only care for that which they can use."
"Yes, and yet he insists on constantly meddling in their affairs long after they've made it clear his 'help' is not desired. His behavior smacks of Starfleet's standard superiority complex."
"The Federation has made enough contact with other species by now to know that each species has its own idea of 'peaceful contact'. There are many who do not perceive Picard's efforts as peaceful."
"We should move to find Picard as quickly as possible. There's no telling how many across the galaxy would jump at the chance to seize a Starfleet legend, even one in training."
